summary: Coke is a type of fuel made from coal or petroleum. It looks like a grey, hard rock and is very porous. Coke is created by heating these materials without air. It is mostly used in industries to smelt iron ore, but also as fuel for cooking or metalworking. There are different types, like petroleum coke, and it can form naturally, too. This process creates a substance called "coke," which is the leftover part after heating coal or petroleum.
title: Coke (fuel)
